page.title: 18THE WASING ESTATE
page.content: Almost half of the survey area belongs to the Wasing Estate which has been in the ownership of the same family for over 300 years. The present Baronet inherited the Estate in 1930 and has held many positions of distinction such as High Sheriff and Vice Lieutenant of Berkshire. The Estate extends far beyond our survey area but all of the parish of Wasing and much of Brimpton falls within it. Many of the formerly tenanted farms are now managed centrally. There is a small dairy herd but the main emphasis is on cereals, with an increasing interest in oil seed rape. Timber is also produced commercially with a long tradition of family interest in fine trees and timber. Parts of the Estate have been subjected to gravel extraction for many years resulting in a number of lakes used by anglers.
